name: TokenERC20

attributes.documentation:
Implementation of the basic standard token
https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-20.md
attributes.name: TokenERC20

attributes.documentation: Transfers _value amount of tokens to address _to, and MUST fire the Transfer event.
attributes.name: _transfer

attributes.documentation:
[ERC20]
Transfers _value amount of tokens to address _to, and MUST fire the Transfer event.
The function SHOULD throw if the _from account balance does not have enough tokens to spend.

     * Note Transfers of 0 values MUST be treated as normal transfers and fire the Transfer event.
attributes.name: transfer

attributes.documentation:
[ERC20]
Transfers _value amount of tokens from address _from to address _to, and MUST fire the Transfer event.
The transferFrom method is used for a withdraw workflow, allowing contracts to transfer tokens on your behalf.
This can be used for example to allow a contract to transfer tokens on your behalf and/or to charge fees in sub-currencies.
The function SHOULD throw unless the _from account has deliberately authorized the sender of the message via some mechanism.

     * Note Transfers of 0 values MUST be treated as normal transfers and fire the Transfer event.
attributes.name: transferFrom

attributes.documentation:
[ERC20]
Allows _spender to withdraw from your account multiple times, up to the _value amount.
If this function is called again it overwrites the current allowance with _value.

     * NOTE: To prevent attack vectors like the one described here and discussed here,
clients SHOULD make sure to create user interfaces in such a way that they set the allowance first to 0 before setting it to another value for the same spender.
THOUGH The contract itself shouldn't enforce it, to allow backwards compatibility with contracts deployed before
attributes.name: approve
